revised_title: Neutron Scattering and Percolation in Antiferromagnetic Insulators
tldr: The article discusses the application of neutron scattering techniques to study phase transitions in disordered antiferromagnetic insulators, particularly near the percolation limit where long-range magnetic order is destroyed. The experiments confirm the multicritical point picture of percolation and provide insights into the temperature scale and exponents related to geometric and thermal behavior.
